Description: Lower body sherd and conical foot of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; glaze fired red-brown; interior: glazed with traces of two added white rings; exterior: bowl reserved, foot glazed; underside reserved; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '44', is written in pen on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 44)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1080) (phase 2)
